txt.en:
'I recognize many of these items, [placeholder]. Some from unwary hunters, some from treasure-seekers, some from valiant fools seeking to end the threat. This one...'

She opens one of the satchels, and pulls out a battered cloth doll.

'This belonged to my son's daughter. She slipped away one evening and was lost to the forest. He knew her lost, and went seeking vengeance against the Shadow Hunter, so this tragedy would never befall anyone else. He was never seen again, leaving two more children fatherless.

'This place has known so much grief it has become a part of the very earth. Everyone living in Arhaim has lost someone. We carry on the best we can, despite these sorrows. You have done us a great service by bringing back these mementos. You have my thanks, [placeholder].'
Garsind, the chieftain of Arhaim, would be interested in these belongings.\n\nYou should talk to Garsind in Arhaim.
Woodmen belongings can be found scattered around Shathur-munzu.\n\nYou should collect Woodmen belongings.
The belongings of the victims of the wargs can be found scattered in Shathur-munzu. You believe the people of Arhaim would be grateful to have them back.
The belongings of the victims of the wargs can be found scattered in Shathur-munzu. You believe the people of Arhaim would be grateful to have them back.
